intro: Fosteria oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca fosteria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a silvery underside, adding to its ornamental appeal. Fosteria oaxacana is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
